DOC.brief_summary: -1498C/T VEGF polymorphism, as suggested by a recent retrospective analysis, seems to have a role in predicting the efficacy of Bevacizumab plus FOLFIRI in first-line treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer patients. The present study aims to prospectively evaluate the predictive role of this polymorphism in metastatic colorectal patients receiving the same treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of VEGF Polymorphism as Predictive Factor in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Treated With Folfiri Plus Bevacizumab
DOC.criteria: Histologically confirmed colorectal adenocarcinoma; Measurable metastatic disease according to RECIST criteria; Patients receiving BV plus FOLFIRI as firstline treatment; Written informed consent; Availability of blood samples for genetic analysis.
